This is beautifully shot, tightly scripted and exceedingly well-acted little masterpiece from Danish auteur, Lars Von Trier. It explores the themes of futility, depression, loneliness and ultimately, the meaninglessness of existence. 

Not a happy story then, but well worth a look if you've ever pondered such things or indeed if you're the pondering kind. Like most great stories it requires a little patience and some thought so, its very easy to see why it doesn't appeal to the average U.S. Pirate-Bay simpleton.  

There's a very good review here:http://www.musicvita.com/music-freak/movies/8661-film-review-melancholia.html

That stunning piece of music used throughout the movie can be found here: http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/4554138/Richard_Wagner_-_Tristan_und_Isolde_-_Bayreuth_1966

I have never logged in just to warn people not to watch a movie, but this movie is awful.  Pointless, slow, the entire first half had nothing to do with the second half, which was still a godawful waste of an hour all by itself.  Save yourself from the misery and pass this one up.  Tree of Life was 100 times better than this, if you want to watch a pointless, slow, meandering piece of shit movie.

Also, for all the people that write about how deep and meaningful this movie is, that is only true in the Emo sense that is a self absorbed, self-important, exploration of depression and self-absorption.  There is nothing deep or meaningful in this movie.  You will not coma away from it with any profound insights about how to live your life, or how to understand any mysteries of your existence.  If you want to wallow in two plus hours of misery, than this one is for you.

Thnx extremezone, one of the best movies of 2011
